intro: Alysicarpus campylocaulis, commonly known as the twisted sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while the pods are slender and curved. Alysicarpus campylocaulis is typically found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields.
